Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: JToaster
Reviews.Content: This place is ok, they've done the best they can do with it. I stayed in a 6 bed dorm, the "Excalibur" room. Apart from being old and slightly run down, it's clean and social enough. It's a little bit above the main part of the Strip, but the Deuce bus (which is 24 hrs) goes right to it so no huge issue there. Walking from the corner to the my room though could've been more enjoyable, but we managed. The only reason I wish I had stayed on the Strip instead of here was because of the experience staying on the Strip. Staff was friendly and helpful when I asked for advice, common area was fine. My major fault was no lockers in the room. Otherwise, it's an ok stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't forget to lock the door before you go to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Rose J
Reviews.Content: We were just staying one night in Las Vegas start looking for a reasonable rate by driving up to motels in this area and asking to see the rooms, this one seemed to be the cleanest one so we stayed. Once we were in our room the lamps did not work so lighting was bad. In the end we woke up around 6:15 a.m. to find our door was slightly open, as the doors don't automatically lock you have to manually lock the door. Needless to say someone came into our room and took my overnight bag which they probably thought was a purse. It had some precious hair barrettes and a silver braclet in it, which are one of kind. Next time I go to Vegas I am staying in a secure hotel, bottom line! The owner didn't even seem to care too much that this happened!

Reviews.Title: “Good on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: maddoghere4d
Reviews.Content: If what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas, this is probably where 'it' stayed. I didn't rate this place that much and the location is veering towards seedy, close to the stratosphere or not. Ah wait, it's Vegas - expect seedy. The room walls are whitewashed blocks, the bathroom clean, the sleep quality average. I was close to the road but not disturbed by noise. I didn't feel too safe walking back here late at night past the winos but to be fair, that's the city not the motel and no matter who you are, you need a walk in the dark! (thanks David Byrne) There was exposed wiring from the plug socket behind the bed head and I regret not mentioning it to the manager (Bob?) who was a really nice guy, very friendly/ funny and helpful to me and to some Asian people struggling with the language, I'm confident he would have sorted the plug. Wifi available. ATM in the foyer and the usual tourist literature. I was only here one night and on a budget. As such, it served it's purpose well enough, it was certainly a good deal financially and the friendly reception was a bonus. So my advice is take it at face value, a cheap motel within walking distance of the strip and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: BernieSt
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nights with my friend. Good budget option with great staff (Bob rocks!! And so does Pancake Lady), good breakfast and a nice pool. It's between the strip and downtown and close to Stratosphere tower. I recommend taking the 24 hour bus for $7.

Reviews.Title: “Okay I've traveled the continent and if you're looking for quick or even long stay...I def recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Travlr2011
Reviews.Content: First off I stayed for almost a year here due to being close to my job. It A) has spectacular customer service! Love Billie the gm. She is awesome. Rooms= Very Clean, not one bug! Spacious Location isn't that great, but only a min away to main strip: fashion show to all hotels/ casino. Boston Pizza and Albos: great food. All Star Chinese: small joint but hidden fantastic chinese! I would stay here again for sure for short independent quick travels. Also not this place is good for long time stay for the price and quality you get. Laundry on site!

Reviews.Title: “Great for travellers on a budget”
Reviews.Author: GappyUK
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights at Tod Motel and had a great time here. It's right on the Strip and you can catch the shuttle bus along to all the bars and attractions for $7 for 24 hours. Bob on reception is very helpful and friendly and I would recommend this place to anyone who is travelling on a budget (as we are) as it's great value for money. The breakfast was plentiful (thank you breakfast lady!) and doesn't end until 11am so you get to lie-in!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaNLCH
Reviews.Content: This hostel was only $15/night so you can't expect too much. I was pleasantly surprised by the nice pool, free wifi, free breakfast (bagels, toast, staff who will make you pancakes!). The 6 bed dorm was spacious and I shared it with only 2 other people. It was clean and on the bed was a towel and handtowel and toothpaste and the room had an ensuite bathroom. Location is a bit far to walk to the main attractions on the strip, so get a bus day pass for 7$. The hostel is very close to the Stratosphere though. Staff was really nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the taxi driver suggested...”
Reviews.Author: eh1colon
Reviews.Content: As we pulled up to the Tod Motor Motel, our taxi driver kindly informed us to "be careful, because this is not a safe area". What a charming welcome to the Silver State. On checking in, the man behind the counter was very helpful and pleasant, albeit a little eccentric. We stayed in a 6-bed dorm, but we were the only 2 people living in it - what a luxury to have a room to ourselves! The room was clean, and although the the mattresses were a little thin (perhaps they should invest in some tempur-pedic mattress), the sleep quality was excellent. It was a little hot, but that was understandable. Perhaps they could have pushed the bunk beds nearer to the walls, but for $15 dollars a night, that gap was perfectly acceptable. When one of us injured ourselves in the street (blood everywhere, it was horrible), the man on duty that night was very helpful, even if his offer of tweezers to help remove the glass looked more like a pair of pliers from his toolbox. All in all we found this most a enjoyable place to spend our few days. There were plenty of characters which the receptionist informed us about, and we were lucky to meet just a few. The motel is a bit far from the strip, but for $15 a night, you can spare $7 a day to ride the Deuce for a whole 24 hour period. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged”
Reviews.Author: xido
Reviews.Content: The room was ok, as were the pancakes. However, they will overcharge you if you don't pay attention, like me. I booked a room in a 4-bed women's dorm room for what should have been $17.00. When I got there, I was charged $27.14 and got a 6-bed women's dorm room instead. I didn't have have a paper copy of my booking confirmation with me at the time, so I didn't dispute it.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore these bad reviews, TOD is excellent for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: RachaelSutherland
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Las Vegas for the first time, 19 years old on a saturday night, overwhelmed with no idea where to stay. I called around 4 hostels and hotels i found on hostelword and none had availability. I eventually called the TOD and the guy on reception could not have been friendlier, assuring me there were plenty rooms and they looked forward to seeing me. When i arrived i checked in, showed my Hostelling International card which saved me $3 a night, and gave me my room key. I was in a dorm room (i needed the cheapest) and it only cost me $16. There were 3 bunk beds in the room for 6 girls but it was only me and 2 other japanese girls who were very quiet. The room was immaculate, sheets and pillowcases crisp white, with towels, handtowels, shower gel on each bed and a night light. The hostel used to be a hotel so in room there was a bathroom and kitchen. Generally im a fussy traveller and the idea of most hostels makes me uncomfortable, i would much rather have my own room, here - i felt very safe, the rooms were cosy, there was a common area 2 doors down from my room that had another kitchen area and microwave, free WIFI, and a TV. I spent Saturday night here with a Canadian woman who made me homemade banana pancakes and maple syrup for my journey back home! Reception staff are so friendly, the guys are amazing, and i cant wait to head back next month!

Reviews.Title: “'find yourself'...”
Reviews.Author: elka007
Reviews.Content: I am Australian, I have lived in asia 2 years, one year in Thailand, one year in India, I have travelled throughout europe with Ireland as my base for 7 years. I have been in America 10 years, most of that in Los Angeles, Miami and New York. What I enjoy about my stay at THE TOD is my peace and privacy, a sense of adventure and a feeling of safety knowing that wonderful people at the tod are providing a very co exist environment where guests can very much have the option of a social experience or retreat to an inner world. There is so much to see and do in the city of las vegas; from a tourist standpoint, there are many wonderful shows and theatrical productions, from a networking standpoint there are conventions and tradeshows year long. As a participant of the entertainment industry I very much cherish the ability to retreat and connect with the spiritual center within during my downtime of the lightshow that spirals to create this very interesting unique town which surprisingly has its nearby natural beauty of red rock. I encourage people to travel the road less travelled enjoy some kareoki at Dinos fri/sat nights enjoy wonderful thai food at thai house and enjoy the local arts community of the first Friday of each month celebrating independant artists. The property of THE TOD is synergistic with the artistic soul, enjoy your journey in this school we call life, learning what classes you choose to explore...xx

Reviews.Title: “Best Hostel Experience”
Reviews.Author: islandwoman77
Reviews.Content: This hostel is in the most fabulous location on Las Vegas Blvd, the world famous strip. It feels homey, clean, welcoming. They even make you homemade pancakes in the morning. I loved being able to check my email in the little internet cafe in the lobby. I was at a total loss of what to do beyond gambling on the strip and their staff helped guide me through possible excursions. I went to see the Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam! The last thing I will say is the staff was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly better than expected”
Reviews.Author: HollyJ52
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I recently stayed at the this motel in Vegas. We were unsure of this place and checked it out online. We decided to go ahead and book our trip and thought if the place is too bad we will go someplace else, as we were on somewhat of a budget. We thought we would be out on the town most of the time anyway. I will admit the location was different than expected although it did make me think of classic Las Vegas from years back. When we checked into our rooms they were clean and better than we expected. We stayed for 4 nights. We were able to do some gambling, sight seeing and even layed out by the pool and was not overly crowded. The staff was friendly and treated us well. The girl at the front desk made some recomendations to us. Overall we had a nice trip. Suited our needs and would return.

Reviews.Title: “very bad customer service good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WALALANG
Reviews.Content: i got in around 5:30pm and check in. the gentleman that help me was very rude and felt like i was annoying him. i believe his name is BOB.. stay away from him.. i complained the next morning and good thing the lady that was there was so helpful and made me feel comfortable and welcome, but first impression last. my reservation was for 5 days but i left the 2nd night..

Reviews.Title: “Classic”
Reviews.Author: p00pypants
Reviews.Content: Looks like THE motel of Vegas, and right near the strip.

Reviews.Title: “great for a group”
Reviews.Author: Chica74_10
Reviews.Content: Arrived at midnight - no problems checking in. Only a $8 cab ride from the Greyhound station. Stayed in a dorm, spacious and clean. Working A/C :-) Bathroom and kitchenette attached to each room, would be awesome if there was a group of you traveling, but this is not so good for me as I like to meet people in a communal kitchen/ lounge/TV area as it's good to get info off others when traveling alone. Bedding but no towel provided. Pool. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good,clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Bryn_williams084
Reviews.Content: Ideal if your backpacking around the world, cheap, clean and plenty of entertainment, not far from the strip, and the staff were very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and good value”
Reviews.Author: wolfsong88
Reviews.Content: The staff were really friendly and very accommodating. I asked about wireless internet in the room and they gave me a room close to reception. The closet area was quite large with a vanity outside of the bathroom. There was just a stand up shower but I wasn't there to soak in a tub. Free cable, free local calls and they added a microwave and mini fridge for free so that was a huge asset for me. The bed was comfortable enough - not anything you'd get at one of the fancier hotels but then again I paid $170 for the week not for the night. The walls are thick and I never heard a single sound the whole time I was there. It is an older property with a lot of history. The area isn't that great for walking around at night but I felt safe as a single female. I would ask for something close to reception. I had room 103. I would stay there again. It's only a 5 min walk to Stratosphere. Best of there are no hidden fees or extras to pay. I paid $170 for the week plus tax came to $195. No surprise bill at the end :)

Reviews.Title: “great service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: boylan2010
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the tod for a couple of nites and just wanted to say the facillites and staff there are more then adequate for a motel i was treted very well and anything i asked for was sorted out straight away, the rooms were very spacious and clean too, no complaints whatsoever, a definite if your lookin for budget accom on las vegas blvd:)

Reviews.Title: “The most friendly and helpful place you'll find in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Joshua2550
Reviews.Content: I came here looking for a bed in an emergency and, not only did I get a good cheap room, but the staff went out of their way to help me with other advice and ways to save expenses and were generally just excellent people. Highly recommended, it has a better feel to it than places worth double the cost.

Reviews.Title: “It's a backpackers not hotel... for the budget traveller - it's great!”
Reviews.Author: melbournegetawaygirl
Reviews.Content: All the bad reviews are such a shame... What were these people looking for? If they were looking for a nice hotel.. clearly they shld rethink it on their budget because clearly, can't afford it... Not sure why you'd say here unless a traveller... The Tod isn't glitzy, the tod doesn't have a huge pool or a casino.. And as a backpackers hostel.. I didn't expect it to. For what it was, the rooms were great, an old converted motel, bunk beds and ensuites.. The convenience of an ensuite in a backpackers and 4 people room? Sensational.. The pool was clean, the staff were amazing! Picked us up from the bus stop and dropped us off too!! So accomodating, outdoor movies, margaritas and a very relaxed environment, free internet!! A small kitchen... everything! Of all the backpackers hostels I stayed in as I crossed America in 2008, this one and another in New Orleans called India House were standouts... If you're a backpacker, ignore the bad reviews... They're wrong..( well unless things have changed dramatically in the last two years..)!!!

Reviews.Title: “A tent under any bridge is better!”
Reviews.Author: SkumBuzzard
Reviews.Content: This is the dirtiest hotel I have ever stayed in. The management were running a day camp for losers and advertise that its some sort of a resort hotel. The carpeting was as dirty as a mechanics garage floor. The dryer ate our clothes. The roaches ate our dinners. They were running a car repair buisness in the rear parking lot. The pool ( if thats what a 8x12 hole filled with water is ) was a wonderful dark green color. Employees could not mind thier own buisness but really seemed to enjoy stalking customers to see what kind of good time they have in the town. This is in the nastiest ghetto area at the end of the strip. Nothing is near this place except the stripper bar directly across the street. Hookers and junkies are all around you at this place so beware of your surroundings!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, bad rooms and close to the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: FeijoaZone
Reviews.Content: No doubt, the service is great, especially if you talk to Craig, hes really helpful and serviceminded. Appreciated that very much. The room I stayed in was in pretty bad shape - cockroaches in the bathroom, no remote to the tv and so on. Should need a serious renovation. Clean sheets and towel though, as well as a good price. A great plus is that it is so very close to the Strip, just a couple of minutes walking distance to the Stratosphere. Internet is only free if you got wifi, but you have to pay for using Oh, the pool was not very fresh. Very small and garbage floating in it. I did not take a swim.

Reviews.Title: “Cell-like rooms”
Reviews.Author: NC-Traveler-47
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in this motel because of the many positive reviews on TripAdvisor.com. I never received a confirmation of my online booking--a special Internet rate of $25 for three nights or more--so I called the front desk. No one answered the phone for a couple of days, but I finally reached someone who confirmed the booking by phone. When I arrived, the desk clerk had my reservation but no record of the rate. He tried to charge me $39, explaining that it was a "holiday weekend." (It wasn't; Labor Day was eight days away.) Another employee intervened and the clerk lowered the rate to $29. I charged five nights on my credit card, sight-unseen--a mistake. The room they offered me looked like a drab prison cell. I complained, and they put me in a much larger room with a kitchenette. It had a nice new carpet. But the cinder-block walls were dirty and chipping; the electrical outlets had no face plates; the smoke detector was disconnected; the bathtub was full of dirt and hair; and the bottom of the shower curtain had a three-inch band of black mold. There was a window air conditioner--it was 105 degrees--but it made such a racket that I couldn't sleep. There was a floodlight that shone through the window all night; the blinds were slightly askew and didn't keep out the light. I was offered one thin towel. An additional dish towel in the kitchenette reeked of mildew. In addition, the promised "free wifi" was in the lobby only. I needed wifi on this trip, and my room got no signal. It felt like a dangerous place to stay. The next morning I asked for a refund of my unused nights, and was told there was a no-refund policy. (Indeed, I had signed a "no illegal activity" agreement, overlooking that it also said no refunds.) When the manager arrived, he did waive the policy and refunded the extra nights, with a small penalty: My first night's room would cost me $40. It was a small price to pay to get out of there. It was evident that the owners take some pride in their motel. When they bought the facility, they say, it was more rundown than it is today. The carpet is a nice touch, and my bed was comfortable. I understand they installed an elevator too. There are two common rooms--the motel doubles as a youth hostel--and I can see how this layout might appeal to some young backpackers. But honestly, the place seemed like both a firetrap and a disease trap.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty, unsafe, eccentric Awful Hostel!!! Dont do it!!”
Reviews.Author: eric8570
Reviews.Content: A friend and I drove down last minute for a friend's wedding and the hostel was very far down the strip in a sketchy area. The office was gross. Employee's were weird 20-somethings. The room was sooo filthy. Stained and ripped sheets, disgusting floor, dirty, small bathroom, two literal wire hangers, NO toilet paper, no trash can anywhere. Dark and Drab room with no views. Needless to say my friend and I got the hell out of there and wanted a full refund. They gave us a refund for 2 of the 3 nights, btiches. DO YOURSELF A FAVOR...FIND A COMFORT SUITES OR MOTEL 6! DO NOT STAY AT TODD'S AAE HOSTEL IN VEGAS! UUUGGGHHH!!!

Reviews.Title: “Save your money for the sloy machine!!!”
Reviews.Author: IpanemaLady
Reviews.Content: Deserved the Top Value Hotel. Very nice staffs. Room was basic but fine. Got everything you need for especially for this price. As i said, let's save your money and throw them in the casino! Vegas! Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay in a the City of Sin”
Reviews.Author: ahab_ze
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with swimming pool and rooms with tv and kitchennet

Reviews.Title: “On the whole very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Memphit
Reviews.Content: I got there in the middle of the night and just crashed out, when I woke in the morning I realised that the place wasnt that clean and the room was tiny and uncomfortable. I had a word with the management and they were exceptionally nice about it and gave me a choice of 2 rooms to swap to. Both replacements were great and very comfortable. Common rooms were great and there was an excellent atmosphere around the building. Nights out organised by them were fun though a would say maybe a tad expensive then what it was worth . Very good fun though. Staff could not hae been more helpful. Though at times I got the feeling that there was something in it for them with their recommendation but thats vegas for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and wonderful time!! Thank you :)”
Reviews.Author: trident1
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the TOD!! :) The staff was so friendly and helpful with everything having answered all of our questions and even had a list of free stuff to do in Vegas!! Ron and Carol were very hospitable in a Hostel way!! Thanks again all!!! I will definitely come back to stay when in Vegas.. Although it was hot (summertime) the pool cooled everyone off....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: mattG2000
Reviews.Content: I ended up driving to Las Vegas and wanted to be near or on the strip. I found the TOD Motor lodge and I am glad I did!! Their prices are very reasonable and I had a very pleasurable time when I stayed. The staff was most helpful with questions and concerns and the accommodations made it worth staying there. Pancake breakfast on sunday was a wonderful touch for breakfast and I enjoyed the swimming pool they have also. I recommend a stay at the TOD if you happen to be in the area of Las Vegas!! Hats off to the entire staff. -Matthew G. Los ANgeles, CA.

Reviews.Title: “Better further down the strip”
Reviews.Author: pdp84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel/motel for a couple of nights, towards the latter part of my trip to Vegas, I decided to check out and book further downtown - to get more in the mix of things. The actual Hotel is only around a fifteen minute walk from the strip itself and there are buses that roam downtown which are easily accessible. My only concern with the hotel was the lack of organisation and the area that it was. I had to wait around for a couple of hours for simple requests to be managed. If your walking back from the strip late at night, then you need to be careful. For the price I paid, I got a much better deal further on the strip, staying at one of the casino resorts. This hotel is your typical dive, if you don't have a bed job. Although the local neighbourhood bar, called 'Dino's' is a nice place to go to experince a real American bar - highly recommended drinking venue. Only book this place, if it's last minute.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and helpful motel”
Reviews.Author: sab27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tod Motel for three nights in October and found the staff there to be so friendly and helpful. The room was huge and very clean and presentable. We booked a kitchette room but did not realise that cutlery, pots and pans were NOT provided. When i told the lady at reception she kindly went out and bought all the equipment to get us through our 3 days. Now how's is that for service!! The motel is within walking distance of Circus Circus and there's a 24 hour bus right outside the motel taking you down to the main strip. This place is excellent value for money and would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great family friendly atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: Gofertpc
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Las Vegas in mid May 2007 for a new job. Needed a place to stay while looking for housing. Money being an issue I stopped at several motels around town and happened upon the TOD as I was sightseeing on the strip. Compared to the review from 2006 this is definitely a different place. Located on the strip just 2 blocks from the Stratoshpere it is very convenient to both the strip and downtown Las Vegas. This family run motel is being completely redone from top to bottom (without interrupting me). Work progresses daily from new murals on the walls to new security gates. Rooms are modest but comfortable. Easy walking distance to several restaraunts (Boston Pizza right across the street is outstanding!). The people running the place have gone out of their wayto be most accomodating. I have stayed here a total of 4 weeks and would recommend it to anyone looking for an affordable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Breathes new life..”
Reviews.Author: ttrraavveell
Reviews.Content: There is new ownership, i was greeted by a very friendly father and daughter team, as it is newly family owned. They were extremely accomodating and offered me a very affordable rate, the room was newly renovated, clean and was conveniently located on the strip, as a 24hr double decker bus passes right by. There were ample laundry facilities with reasonable prices, and had a home away from home feel. I would stay again. I also just spotted it in the movie LUCKY YOU with Drew Barrymore, loved it!

HotelInfo.Name: Tod Motor Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 1508 Las Vegas Blvd. S., Las Vegas, NV 89104
